80ee4050-9437-4a65-a28c-87dd62360b61.description: The earner of the Inclusive Communication Strategies microcredential has demonstrated the ability to select the most appropriate strategy for supporting inclusive communications, given a series of connected scenarios. While the context is workplace communication, this skill is transferable to all other communication settings.
80ee4050-9437-4a65-a28c-87dd62360b61.name: Inclusive Communication Strategies

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the microcredential have engaged with a series of scenarios that describe inclusive communication issues in a workplace setting. Earners must have identified the most appropriate strategy to implement in each scenario, in order to foster an environment that supports inclusive communication. Feedback and rationale are provided throughout each asynchronous scenario activity.

9f5c752b-7f82-4457-97c8-86736a190b03.description: The earner has demonstrated Python basic programming skills including converting data types, string manipulation, for & while loops, lambda function, range functions, and generating random integer lists using normal, exponential, and uniform distributions. Earners have demonstrated how to import libraries and use library functions to simplify their Python code. Earners have also demonstrated the ability to clean, modify, and merge data into one uniform data frame.
9f5c752b-7f82-4457-97c8-86736a190b03.name: Python Foundational Bootcamp

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the Python Foundational Bootcamp microcredential have successfully submitted portfolio evidence of properly formatted Python code, using markdown text and comments, in Jupyter Notebook. The earner created a list of integers, performed a mathematical operation on each integer and assigned integers to a new list.

Earners of the Python Foundational Bootcamp Microcredential have successfully submitted portfolio evidence of properly formatted Python code in a Jupyter notebook that imported built-in modules to combine files of different formats, eliminated duplicates, and wrote a single CSV file sorted alphabetically by country.

7dd34a15-9eb7-47ae-87dc-ca54948f2ad2.description: The earner of the Organizational Inclusion Strategies microcredential has demonstrated the ability to recommend strategies that could be used by leaders to foster inclusion in their organizations. They are required to provide rationale for those recommendations.
7dd34a15-9eb7-47ae-87dc-ca54948f2ad2.name: Organizational Inclusion Strategies

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential have submitted a written recommendation detailing strategies for fostering inclusive workplaces, and providing a rationale for those choices. Feedback and evaluation is provided by an instructor who is a subject matter expert.

ae495042-7eeb-4195-9b88-8824a797e1e4.description: The earner of the Inclusive Communications Analysis microcredential has demonstrated the ability to analyze both effective and non-effective strategies for inclusive communications, reflecting on the elements that make successful communication possible.
ae495042-7eeb-4195-9b88-8824a797e1e4.name: Inclusive Communications Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential have submitted a written analysis of communication strategies they have witnessed in the workplace, determining their effectiveness in facilitating inclusivity amongst coworkers. Earners have identified the necessary elements for inclusive communication strategies. Feedback and evaluations were provided by the instructor - a subject matter expert.

5a6c2366-f833-4166-b83c-61c2fd27d9de.description: The earner of this microcredential demonstrated foundational elements of listening and speaking, from a business communications perspective, in a professional setting. These skills include: collaboration, interpersonal relations, and communicating core business practices and models.
5a6c2366-f833-4166-b83c-61c2fd27d9de.name: Business Communications for Researchers: Listening & Speaking

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential demonstrated written and verbal communication skills to a group of individuals throughout a workshop. They received feedback from an instructor on their ability to: pitch their idea in under one minute; communicate their value proposition; and summarize the problem they are solving.

6bfe5739-06f6-43f5-9fbf-bb0e41035f8d.description: The microcredential earner has demonstrated the ability to plan strategies to mitigate challenging behaviors that may occur during facilitation with a group of adults before disruptions happen.
6bfe5739-06f6-43f5-9fbf-bb0e41035f8d.name: Planning Facilitation with Adult Learners

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential have submitted a plan that outlines strategies for mitigating challenging behaviours that may arise during a facilitation with adults.

4d7f25c2-2535-4548-a59a-0b22faa704a2.description: The earner of this microcredential can identify various strategies for fostering inclusivity in teaching and learning. This follows self-reflection and analysis of one’s own biases, privilege, and barriers.
4d7f25c2-2535-4548-a59a-0b22faa704a2.name: Inclusive Education Planning

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential have demonstrated the ability to draft a plan which identifies effective and inclusive teaching and learning practices. This is assessed by an instructor for its clarity, choice of techniques, and the rationale of their choices.

b186056c-1beb-499b-8cca-5bd64e26f508.description: The earner of this microcredential can identify instructional methods appropriate for a given situation with adult learners. Earning this microcredential means that participants have extensive knowledge of a variety of instructional methods appropriate for adult instruction.
b186056c-1beb-499b-8cca-5bd64e26f508.name: Instructional Methods for Adult Learners

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential can identify an appropriate instructional methodology for a given scenario. They have submitted a written assignment outlining: the methodology selected, rationale for their choice, and the appropriate timings for the instruction.

451bb424-1847-43a2-9276-b3a5ab25d2ff.description: The earner has the ability to explain and employ the various steps and stages of program design for adult learning contexts. Earners can design effective workshops in both workplace and educational contexts.
451bb424-1847-43a2-9276-b3a5ab25d2ff.name: Program Design for Adult Learners

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential have demonstrated the ability to design a basic workshop or program that might be needed in their workplace context. Earners have outlined: a needs assessment strategy, learning outcomes, and an assessment plan.

3d5b5b3c-15fe-4b25-b061-e34a28a16856.description: The earner of this microcredential can successfully complete the initial stages of a needs assessment interview, including: appropriate use of verbal and non-verbal communication, strong listening skills, establish rapport and build the working alliance, gather appropriate information, demonstrate questioning skills, and appropriately explain confidentiality
3d5b5b3c-15fe-4b25-b061-e34a28a16856.name: Needs Assessment: Foundations

alignments.name: The National Competency Profile for Career Development Professionals

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have recorded the first 10 minutes of a client needs assessment. This involves demonstrating communication skills (non-verbal, verbal, and listening), building the working alliance, and needs assessment skills (questioning, relevant information-gathering). Earners have reviewed the recording and completed a self-evaluation, in addition to receiving written feedback from an instructor.

d8c065e0-43b3-4058-bd6e-139503d99529.description: The earner of the Applied Adult Learning Theory microcredential can apply appropriate adult learning theories to the development of new learning experiences.
d8c065e0-43b3-4058-bd6e-139503d99529.name: Applied Adult Learning Theory

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential have successfully designed a short adult learning experience and have identified the relevant learning theories used in their design process.

50a30778-437f-4b67-975d-f7baa1a8784f.description: The earner of the EDIA Strategy Implementation microcredential has demonstrated the ability to analyze a particular EDIA strategy that can be implemented in the workplace. This analysis is supported by course materials, academic literature, and personal experience.
50a30778-437f-4b67-975d-f7baa1a8784f.name: EDIA Strategy Implementation

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential have written an analysis detailing: their chosen EDIA strategy, expected outcomes, possible challenges, interventions to handle resistance to the strategy. The analysis is supported with course content, academic literature, and lived experience. Feedback and evaluation is provided by the instructor - a subject matter expert.

637cea46-ce96-4dd8-a314-99a5c02419a3.description: The earner of the Business Case for Diverse Teams microcredential has demonstrated the ability to present a business case/rationale for fostering diverse teams in the workplace (as opposed to focusing on homogeneous teams). The case is supported with course readings, personal/professional experiences, and external research.
637cea46-ce96-4dd8-a314-99a5c02419a3.name: Business Case for Diverse Teams

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential have submitted a business case outlining the need to foster diverse teams in the workplace. The earner has highlighted the benefits, opportunities, and role of leadership in fostering these inclusive teams. Feedback and evaluations were provided by the instructor - a subject matter expert.

457b9ef6-a460-4471-934d-be28fd141e58.description: Earners of the microcredential are competent in conducting interviews to make individual and organizational recommendations to resolve interpersonal and intercultural conflict.
457b9ef6-a460-4471-934d-be28fd141e58.name: Interpersonal and Intercultural Conflict Management Resolution

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential have conducted a mock interview demonstrating interview techniques for interpersonal and intercultural conflict management. They proposed suitable recommendations for the individual to resolve the workplace conflict and made recommendations to influence organizational policy to address the interpersonal and intercultural conflict. Earners of this microcredential had their interview and recommendations assessed by an instructor using a rubric.

2abf022e-1d04-43d1-a1fc-cf174d98161b.description: Earners of the Effective Leadership Microcredential can identify and introduce new leadership concepts and strategies into a professional workplace environment.
2abf022e-1d04-43d1-a1fc-cf174d98161b.name: Effective Leadership Practices

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this Effective Leadership Microcredential identified and incorporated a new leadership concept into a workplace context. The earner authored an in-depth report, which included their strategy, challenges, and success factors. This report was evaluated by an instructor using a rubric.

0075e0d6-8ca8-4292-ae21-81059da2e77d.description: The earner of this microcredential can create a business model canvas for their proposed commercial product, based on their laboratory research. Through conducting customer interviews over the 2-month program, participants will build out their business model canvas and use their interview findings to validate and/or invalidate their value propositions.
0075e0d6-8ca8-4292-ae21-81059da2e77d.name: Business Model Generation - Business Model Canvas

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential present, and receive feedback on, their business model canvas on a weekly basis. Earners also synthesize a "pivot or persevere" decision on their commercial idea, based on their primary market research and current business model canvas.

75be5842-a86a-47ea-8ab1-eb31f038e68d.description: The earners of the Primary Market Research microcredential demonstrate foundational elements of primary market research by conducting up to 100 interviews with potential customers or stakeholders. As learners explore the commercial potential of their research, they develop skills around interviewing, interpretation and analysis, and decision-making with value propositions.
75be5842-a86a-47ea-8ab1-eb31f038e68d.name: Primary Market Research: Interviewing Customers

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential present weekly on interview findings, summarize these findings, and synthesize their decision around a commercial idea. This involves: interview skills (asking questions clearly, active listening, summarizing key thoughts), interpretation of qualitative data (identifying themes), and decision-making based on the data. Instructors provide feedback.

4d20d49f-5367-42a0-9581-827ccfa88bc5.description: Earners of the "Responding to Mental Distress" microcredential can identify signs of mental distress in others and the appropriate ways to respond, including the types of conversations to have with the person in distress, where/how to access resources, and what to encourage for appropriate self-care.
4d20d49f-5367-42a0-9581-827ccfa88bc5.name: Responding to Mental Distress

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential engaged with a scenario to correctly identify ways to recognize and respond to common signs of mental distress in a workplace context. When presented with alternative responses to a colleague in distress, the learner chose an appropriate action 100% of the time. This was assessed through a standardized multiple-choice, online assessment.

b93c3e0a-1fcb-4ccc-b9b4-2b6e8370a725.description: Earners of this Strategic Solutions Microcredential are competent in developing strategies to resolve workplace challenges and/or dilemmas.
b93c3e0a-1fcb-4ccc-b9b4-2b6e8370a725.name: Strategic Problem Solving for Leaders

badge_template_activities.title: Earners developed, executed, and adapted strategies around a strategic challenge in simulation exercises over 8 weeks, which was assessed by an instructor using a rubric.

d0bbaa50-379f-47d9-821b-ca94306d36e8.description: The earner of this microcredential has demonstrated the ability to think strategically about public communications on behalf of an organization. The earner can devise effective public communications for an organization, including addressing specific publics’ communication needs and utilizing communication tactics to reach those publics.
d0bbaa50-379f-47d9-821b-ca94306d36e8.name: Strategic Public Communication Planning for Leaders

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has authored a public communications plan for an organization about a project, initiative, or issue. This process involves documenting what needs to be communicated, what publics need to be reached, and the strategy for delivering that information. Completion of the assessment requires outlining strategic considerations, setting communication goals, and measuring the communication efforts to ensure success.

ef1fffdc-b54c-44e2-a7c2-8a3574edf599.description: The earner of the Tractor Safety microcredential is competent in operating a tractor with an attached implement on Nova Scotia roads. The earner can conduct pre-operation checks, attach front and rear-mounted implements, and safely operate a tractor and implement with a combined weight of 14,000 kg or less.
ef1fffdc-b54c-44e2-a7c2-8a3574edf599.name: Tractor Safety

badge_template_activities.title: Score grade of at least 70% on final written assessment.

Earners of this microcredential have scored 70% or higher on two practical driving assessments. They have demonstrated their ability to safely attach an implement, start tractor, drive forward, drive a full course route, stop on a hill, back up with implement attached, park, unhitch and stop tractor.

db41958f-3199-4e2e-b59b-9c361ecf37d3.description: Earners of this microcredential are able to identify logical and practical strategies to resolve information access and privacy problems using FOIPOP legislation requirements.
db41958f-3199-4e2e-b59b-9c361ecf37d3.name: Information Access and Privacy Problem Solving

badge_template_activities.title: Earners prioritized FOIPOP requirements and developed logical strategies to resolve information access and privacy issues for 4 real life case studies (2 for information access and 2 for privacy issues). Earners outlined steps to immediately respond to the issue, identified required resources, relevant and applicable legislative provisions, and developed an effective course of action and rationale in response to each scenario. This was evaluated by an instructor using a rubric.

4b4a4ace-b9f4-4baf-a848-103681256135.description: Earners of the Laser Safety microcredential are able to take the necessary measures to safely operate a laser or laser system, particularly a Class 3B or 4 laser. The earner can confidently: assess key elements of the laser such as wavelength; classification and power; identify potential beam and non-beam hazards; and implement the appropriate control measures to protect themselves and others.
4b4a4ace-b9f4-4baf-a848-103681256135.name: Laser Safety Awareness

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential engaged with a series of scenarios to safely operate a laser or laser system as a user in a research setting. Earners identified the most appropriate strategy to achieve a safe environment while operating a laser in each scenario. Feedback and rationale were provided throughout each asynchronous scenario activity.

3f919c54-63c1-4dae-a015-45e437cd313d.description: Earners of the Positive Culture Planning microcredential are able to develop an action plan with strengths-based strategies to influence positive change in a workplace setting.
3f919c54-63c1-4dae-a015-45e437cd313d.name: Positive Culture Planning

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential applied the four dimensions of an appreciative inquiry model to develop an action plan that includes a minimum of 2 interventions for their workplace to improve their team or organizational culture. Earners were required to provide three external references to support their observations and conclusions. The action plan was evaluated by an instructor using a rubric.

3112fc93-220a-444d-9d5c-30460286fb43.description: Earners of the Woodworking Lab Equipment Safety Microcredential have demonstrated knowledge of how to adhere to safety procedures at all times while inside the woodworking lab area. They can identify, and operate under, any specific safety requirements while using each tool.
3112fc93-220a-444d-9d5c-30460286fb43.name: Woodworking Lab Equipment Safety

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this Wood Lab Safety Microcredential demonstrated safe handling and use of woodworking tools found in a lab or shop. Earners scored 85% or higher on an online theory of shop and tool safety quiz. Earners demonstrated safe handling and use (in-person) which was verified by an instructor or lab supervisor.

fc2d8df6-0219-4211-a0d0-9c9efe2f1de0.description: Earners of the Performance Coaching microcredential are competent in developing a coaching plan to improve individual performance.
fc2d8df6-0219-4211-a0d0-9c9efe2f1de0.name: Performance Coaching

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the Performance Coaching microcredential developed a coaching plan to advance the skills of an employee through a given scenario. The earner identified and/or demonstrated all components of the coaching process which included: performance goal(s), an achievement plan, and measures for success. The plan was evaluated by an instructor using a rubric.

b46581e5-5e7c-4210-b73b-cfbd531b6d53.description: The earner of this microcredential can assess and make recommendations to improve an organization’s social responsibility, which includes the following: environmental footprint, employee engagement, transparency, waste management, human rights performance, community investment, and responsible supply chain management.
b46581e5-5e7c-4210-b73b-cfbd531b6d53.name: Assessing Corporate Social Responsibility

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential compared and assessed the approaches of two organizations regarding their actions towards corporate social responsibility and sustainability, with a focus on alignment to international agreements and financial impact. Their analysis was evaluated by the course instructor for insightfulness, depth, feasibility, sustainability, and linkages to UN guidelines using a standardized rubric.

241ca853-9689-4b02-98f7-abda197dac3a.description: Earners of the Ethical Decision-Making microcredential can apply ethical decision-making practices to ethical dilemmas in a professional leadership context.
241ca853-9689-4b02-98f7-abda197dac3a.name: Ethical Decision Making

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential identified and applied an ethical decision-making model and critical aspects of confidentiality, privacy, and informed consent policies/guidelines to a dilemma in a case study. The earners presented their findings in a report that was evaluated by an instructor using a rubric.

a3da5747-59a1-46dd-a7a5-4f807cc43c6d.description: Earners of this microcredential have demonstrated that they can analyze a basic set of financial statements to support organizational decision making.
a3da5747-59a1-46dd-a7a5-4f807cc43c6d.name: Financial Decision-Making

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential reviewed year-over-year financial statements to identify potential trends and the most critical issues for an organization based on a real scenario. Earners shared their findings in a report which was evaluated by an instructor using a rubric.

388a05f2-65c1-4312-b796-8fc8e918723f.description: Earners of this JavaScript Coding Microcredential are proficient in applying core coding concepts using the JavaScript language. These concepts include storing data in variables, writing conditional and iterative expressions and statements and encapsulating code into functions. Earners are also able to develop, maintain and troubleshoot JavaScript applications of moderate complexity.
388a05f2-65c1-4312-b796-8fc8e918723f.name: JavaScript Coding Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential used a code shell to design and implement a JavaScript quiz application. Skills utilized included writing decision making statements, manipulating data stored in arrays, performing iterations, and organizing code blocks into functions. Earners also demonstrated their knowledge of the JavaScript language through their choice of quiz questions.

d5ee435a-914b-448a-ae97-2cfe1e3b657f.description: Earners of the Microcredential Design badge have demonstrated that they can successfully design a microcredential that aligns to specific criteria set out by Dalhousie University.
d5ee435a-914b-448a-ae97-2cfe1e3b657f.name: Microcredential Design

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge designed a microcredential that met the strongest criteria (Group A) set out in the Dal Microcredential Approval Rubric. They identified & adequately described a skill/competency that aligns with labour market needs & developed a competency-based assessment strategy. They designed sequential steps that lead to an overall skill/competency. They submitted the design using the Dal Microcredential application, which was assessed through the Dal Microcredential Approval Process.

78c45f2e-b142-41ef-8e7a-afc55a81a8d2.description: Earners of the Organizational Design microcredential can identify organizational design challenges and assess the impact on individual and team performance.
78c45f2e-b142-41ef-8e7a-afc55a81a8d2.name: Organizational Design

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential conducted an organizational analysis that included a description of the current organizational structure, recommendations on how that structure can be redesigned to meet future challenges, and the potential impact these changes have on individual and team performance. Earners presented their findings through a report, video, podcast, blog or infographic that was assessed by the instructor using a rubric.

ec487fe5-9899-41e7-ba1a-6644b679ac01.description: Earners of this microcredential can prepare an organization's recruitment strategy.
ec487fe5-9899-41e7-ba1a-6644b679ac01.name: Talent Acquisition

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential developed a 6-layer recruitment strategy for customer service positions based on a scenario provided. Earners addressed external issues that impact recruitment, the organizational brand, the recruiter/hiring manager relationship, and defined the search parameters, including how they would conduct and evaluate the search. A recruitment strategy was presented through a report, video, or presentation that was evaluated by the instructor using a rubric.

1c202a9f-0f88-443c-8c70-4d3db62a378a.description: Earners of the 3D Printer and Laser Cutter Safety Microcredential have demonstrated adherence to safety procedures at all times while inside the lab area. They can identify, and operate under, any specific safety requirements while using each tool.
1c202a9f-0f88-443c-8c70-4d3db62a378a.name: 3D Printer and Laser Cutter Safety

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this Microcredential demonstrated safe handling and use of CNC maker space equipment including 3D printers and laser cutters. Earners scored 85% or higher on an online theory of shop and tool safety quiz. Earners demonstrated safe handling and use (in-person) which was verified by an instructor or lab supervisor.

84040cc6-44e8-4e20-8d2d-7073ad21f2d4.description: The badge earner has developed a sustained mindfulness practice which has resulted in an increased ability to stay calm and focused in high-stress situations, increased resilience, and improved decision-making and problem-solving capabilities.
84040cc6-44e8-4e20-8d2d-7073ad21f2d4.name: Applied Mindfulness Strategies at Work

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner identified the mindfulness strategies that they would implement in a stressful scenario and provided rationale in a written action plan for those decisions. Their mindfulness plan was evaluated by their instructor.

1d7aad2c-e5b0-4279-96fa-841522a36bcc.description: Earners of the Applying EDIA to Language Education Microcredential can assess and apply key concepts, principles, and practices of Equity, Diversity, Inclusion, and Accessibility (EDIA) and Universal Design for Learning (UDL) to their language teaching practice.
1d7aad2c-e5b0-4279-96fa-841522a36bcc.name: Applying EDIA to Language Education

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential prepared a diversity statement to inform their teaching and learning practice that incorporated key concepts, principles, and practices of EDIA and UDL for language education. They applied the knowledge and relevance of EDIA and UDL frameworks and strategies to a detailed lesson plan. These were assessed by a subject matter expert using rubrics. Earners achieved a grade of B or higher (on the Dalhousie Grade Scale) and a grade of 75% or higher in the course.

f59235fb-3fa1-429c-87c9-f4da410f7643.description: Earners of the Critical Thinking for Decision-Making Microcredential can critically assess and synthesize multiple forms of data, feedback, and information to support decision making in a leadership context. They can select appropriate data sources, identify limitations of decision making related to their own bias, construct questions to elicit a deeper understanding of a problem, and identify communication issues and constraints.
f59235fb-3fa1-429c-87c9-f4da410f7643.name: Critical Thinking for Decision-Making

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential identified appropriate data sources, communication issues, and power structures that influence decision-making within a complex scenario. They examined their personal biases that influence this interpretation through journaling, and demonstrated their ability to elicit a deeper understanding of an issue using Socratic questioning (both verbally and digitally). An instructor used a mastery-based learning approach & earners met the minimum standards within a rubric.

c33c6b30-6122-483f-9224-3ebeb0f04201.description: Earners of this microcredential can prepare an objective-based marketing plan.
c33c6b30-6122-483f-9224-3ebeb0f04201.name: Developing an Objective-based Marketing Plan

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential developed a detailed objective-based marketing plan that included a situational analysis, product/service strategy, distribution strategy, and implementation and control strategy. This report was assessed by an instructor using a rubric.

e6d3e1ba-454a-4611-a194-baefd7abcaf1.description: Earners of the Fish Health Assessment and Diagnostic Procedures Microcredential have demonstrated the ability to use a health assessment scoring matrix and observe fish for their general level of health and welfare. They can identify internal anatomy of a fish, identify common fish parasites, and perform a gross fish necropsy. The earner can prepare tissue samples for lab analysis, which involves preserving samples in formalin and may include loading a tissue cassette.
e6d3e1ba-454a-4611-a194-baefd7abcaf1.name: Fish Health Assessment and Diagnostic Procedures

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this Microcredential used a recognized fish health monitoring matrix to assess videos of 3 species showing clinical signs of health concerns and produced a summary of findings. Earners completed a gross fish necropsy and prepared tissue samples for lab analysis. They identified common external parasites and labelled internal anatomy from photographs. Evidence of the necropsy & tissue sample preparation were collected via video (up to 5 min)

1adb2a36-9cf9-4495-a34f-d6487cb7a0eb.description: Earners of the Fish Research Facility and Water Analysis Microcredential have conducted a site and water analysis in a fish research facility, analysed data, and made recommendations to improve water quality, operation, and maintenance of the site for better fish health.
1adb2a36-9cf9-4495-a34f-d6487cb7a0eb.name: Fish Research Facility and Water Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential evaluated the physical structure & building components of a fish research facility & made recommendations to improve the operation & maintenance of the site. Earners demonstrated an understanding of tank flows, oxygen balance & waste removal of a fish holding tank. They analysed water quality measurements taken over time, provided a breakdown of the issues, & suggested mitigation strategies. Evidence provided: a checklist, water analysis summary, & recommendations

5f915529-61fe-46ac-b347-1f221a0c69ab.description: Earners of the High Performance Mentoring of Entrepreneurs Microcredential are able to conduct long form mentor sessions for entrepreneurs and support a mentee in a high intensity/pressure situation. They are able to utilize principles of equity, diversity and inclusion in their approach, establish a foundation of trust and psychological safety, demonstrate active listening and questioning techniques, deliver and receive constructive feedback, and identify and categorize mentee goals.
5f915529-61fe-46ac-b347-1f221a0c69ab.name: High Performance Mentoring of Entrepreneurs

badge_template_activities.title: Earners demonstrated their ability to support a mentee through case studies & role play. Earners were evaluated through 20 minute mentor sessions that included high pressure situations. Earners demonstrated active listening & effective questioning. They delivered constructive feedback & identified goals from most pressing to least pressing. A mastery-based learning approach to evaluation was used & minimum standards (based on MindFrame Connect Principles of Mentorship) were met using a rubric.

c0800f28-84c0-4373-8a01-3a17b7a86d7d.description: Earners of the Metal Fabrication Equipment Safety Microcredential have demonstrated adherence to safety procedures at all times while inside the metal lab area. They can identify, and operate under, any specific safety requirements while using each tool.
c0800f28-84c0-4373-8a01-3a17b7a86d7d.name: Metal Fabrication Equipment Safety

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this Microcredential demonstrated safe handling and use of metal fabrication tools found in a lab or shop. Earners scored 85% or higher on an online theory of shop and tool safety quiz. Earners demonstrated safe handling and use (in-person) which was verified by an instructor or lab supervisor.

213319eb-98d1-40a6-9f31-fdb181b4b616.description: Earners of the Personal Intercultural Communication Assessment microcredential can identify and assess their own intercultural competence and develop strategies to be more successful as an intercultural communicator in a specific higher education context.
213319eb-98d1-40a6-9f31-fdb181b4b616.name: Personal Intercultural Communication Assessment

badge_template_activities.title: Earners developed a plan to enhance their own intercultural communication competence. They engaged with a series of intercultural scenarios set in an academic setting and identified the differences between specific cultural dimensions. They created a public portfolio that included a personal intercultural skills inventory (with examples from their work & life experiences) and a plan to improve their own competence as an intercultural communicator within their current role in higher education.

2374ea1c-d7fd-4351-9366-5a9238fca984.description: Les titulaires du micro-certificat "Réagir à la détresse mentale chez les autres" peuvent identifier les signes de détresse mentale chez les autres, ainsi que les réponses appropriées, incluant le type de conversation à avoir avec la personne en détresse, où/comment accéder à des ressources et comment encourager les autosoins appropriés.
2374ea1c-d7fd-4351-9366-5a9238fca984.name: Réagir à la détresse mentale

badge_template_activities.title: Les titulaires de ce micro-certificat se sont engagés dans un scénario pour identifier correctement les moyens de reconnaître et de répondre aux signes courants de détresse mentale dans un contexte de travail. Les titulaires ont choisi l’action appropriée parmi des façons alternatives de répondre à un ou une collègue en détresse dans 100% des cas. Ceci a été évalué au moyen d’une évaluation en ligne standardisée à choix multiples.

cbf04d15-0e11-46c2-854b-acda4ff8bffd.description: Earners of the Strategies for the Internationalization of the Curriculum (IoC) microcredential can critically assess different approaches, trends, ethical issues, and their own professional context to develop strategies to internationalize the curriculum for specific contexts within higher education.
cbf04d15-0e11-46c2-854b-acda4ff8bffd.name: Strategies for the Internationalization of the Curriculum

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential used key concepts, frameworks, and trends to critically analyze their own professional context and identify opportunities for the application of IoC strategies. Earners submitted a video presentation to communicate an IoC initiative grounded in the strategies outlined in this course and considered relevant and appropriate to their professional context. This was assessed by a subject matter expert using a rubric. Earners achieved a grade of 75% or higher.

573409d8-be00-49ba-94ad-5509fc65a07b.description: Earners of the Technology in Language Education Microcredential can apply key concepts and frameworks for using technology in language education to teach a lesson using one or more digital tools.
573409d8-be00-49ba-94ad-5509fc65a07b.name: Technology in Language Education

badge_template_activities.title: Following the Backward Design process and UDL guidelines, earners planned and delivered a language lesson using one or more digital tools or resources. The recorded lesson was assessed by a subject matter expert using a TPACK-informed rubric, and achieved a B grade or higher on the Dalhousie Grade Scale. Earners achieved a grade of 75% or higher in this course overall.

f9896afa-a426-42ec-bf1c-6e1ff3bc4112.description: The earner of the Training Plan Design microcredential for the Canadian Coast Guard works or has worked as an On the Job Training Instructor, and has demonstrated the ability to develop components of a training plan. These components include: a sample lesson plan, a feedback document, and an evaluation plan.
f9896afa-a426-42ec-bf1c-6e1ff3bc4112.name: Training Plan Design - Canadian Coast Guard

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential have demonstrated the ability to draft a lesson plan for their On the Job Training Instructor position, complete with content, activities, and an assessment.

Earners of this microcredential have demonstrated the ability to provide constructive feedback to peers on practice facilitation sessions in a written document outlining the strengths and areas for improvement.

Earners of this microcredential have demonstrated the ability to draft an evaluation plan to use with their trainees. This plan identifies the evaluation strategy(ies) used and rationale behind this choice.

02ba23db-3843-4949-a1c2-d2642ba67739.description: Earners of the Writing for Academic Publication Microcredential have demonstrated their ability to plan and compose a complete, original academic article—or an article section— appropriate for a specific, learner-identified professional media venue.
02ba23db-3843-4949-a1c2-d2642ba67739.name: Writing for Academic Publication

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this microcredential planned, composed, revised, and edited an original academic article or article section appropriate for a specific, learner-identified professional media venue. The final version of the article or article section was assessed by a writing and editing professional using a rubric and achieved a B grade or higher on the Dalhousie Grade Scale. Earners achieved a grade of 75% or higher in this course overall.
